meanings.definition: Very small in size or amount.
meanings.sent1: The ant carried a minuscule crumb back to its nest.
meanings.sent2: The minuscule flower bloomed in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The minuscule kitten tried to pounce on a big ball of yarn.
meanings.sent4: Her minuscule voice was barely audible over the loud music.
meanings.sent5: The minuscule pebble seemed lost among the larger rocks.

meanings.definition: Written in or in the size of small letters.
meanings.sent1: The professor's notes were filled with minuscule handwriting.
meanings.sent2: The ancient manuscript was written in minuscule script.
meanings.sent3: She struggled to read the minuscule text without her glasses.
meanings.sent4: The detective examined the minuscule clues left at the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully painted minuscule details on the tiny canvas.
